senses.de: Worried and not able to relax, especially about future events
senses.ex: She was apprehensive about the job interview.

Tips.title: Nuance of Uncertainty
Tips.description: Expresses fear or concern about something that hasn't happened yet, but might.
Tips.example: He was apprehensive about the weather forecast for the camping trip.

Tips.title: Not Always Negative
Tips.description: Can imply a sense of cautious optimism or curiosity, not just fear.
Tips.example: She felt apprehensive yet excited about studying abroad.

Tips.title: Intensity of Feeling
Tips.description: Indicates a milder form of fear compared to 'terrified' or 'horrified'.
Tips.example: The audience was slightly apprehensive before the controversial play began.

senses.de: Showing understanding or awareness of something
senses.ex: The child showed an apprehensive knowledge of the upcoming change in their life.

Tips.title: Aware Understanding
Tips.description: Highlights a keen awareness of a situation, often hinting at insight or foresight.
Tips.example: His apprehensive view on the project's challenges impressed his team.

Tips.title: Subtle Acknowledgement
Tips.description: May suggest a quiet or modest level of insight, rather than a loud declaration.
Tips.example: She nodded with an apprehensive smile, acknowledging the risks involved.

Tips.title: Not Immediate
Tips.description: Usually reflects an understanding developed over time, not an instantaneous grasp.
Tips.example: After months of research, he had an apprehensive grasp of the subject.

Anxious.wordDefinition:
Anxious and apprehensive both mean to feel worried or nervous about something that might happen in the future.

However, anxious often refers to a general feeling of unease or worry, while apprehensive tends to be more specific, referring to worry about a particular situation or event.

For example, you might feel anxious about starting a new school year, but apprehensive about giving a speech in front of your class.

Concern.wordDefinition:
Concern means to have an interest or care about something or someone. For example, a parent might have concerns about their child's safety on a school trip.

While both words express a sense of worry, apprehensive is more focused on an individual's personal anxiety, while concern is more general and can be applied to a wider range of topics or situations.

Doubtful.wordDefinition:
Doubtful refers to feeling uncertain or skeptical about something.

If someone is doubtful about a claim made by a politician, they would be unsure whether to believe it or not.

Fearful.wordDefinition:
Apprehensive means feeling uneasy or uncertain about something that may happen in the future, while the word fearful means feeling afraid or scared in the present moment.

If you are walking alone at night and hear someone following you, you may feel fearful for your safety.

Apprehensive refers to a feeling of anxious uncertainty about the unknown, while fearful pertains to a feeling of scared or intimidated by something threatening in the present moment.

Hesitant.wordDefinition:
Apprehensive means feeling worried or anxious about a future event, while hesitant means feeling unsure or uncertain about taking action.

We use hesitant when we are unsure about taking a certain action. For example, if you're not sure if you want to go to a party, you might say "I'm hesitant to go to the party because I don't know anyone there.".

Both words relate to a sense of uncertainty or doubt, but apprehensive is used more for concerns about future events, while hesitant is used more for concerns about taking immediate action.

Jumpy.wordDefinition:
Both apprehensive and jumpy describe a feeling of nervousness or fear, but they differ in their causes and intensity.

Jumpy means being easily startled or frightened by something sudden or unexpected.

It's a more specific term, indicating a quick, reactive response. For example, you might be jumpy if someone sneaks up on you, if you hear a loud noise, or if you're in a scary movie.

Apprehensive describes a general feeling of fear or anxiety, while jumpy describes a sudden, physical reaction to something startling.

Nervous.wordDefinition:
Apprehensive means feeling worried or uneasy about something that may happen in the future, while nervous means feeling uneasy or anxious about something that is happening right now.

For example, someone might feel apprehensive about an upcoming exam because they are worried about how they will do. On the other hand, they might feel nervous during the exam because of the pressure they are feeling in that moment.

Apprehensive is more about future events that haven't happened yet, while nervous is more about present situations that are causing anxiety or unease.

Tense.wordDefinition:
Tense means feeling nervous or stressed about a situation that is happening right now.

It is often used to describe someone who is physically or mentally strained because of a current situation. For example, "I am feeling tense during this meeting because my boss is criticizing my work.".

Both words relate to feelings of anxiety, but apprehensive is more about the future, while tense is more about the present.

Uneasy.wordDefinition:
The term apprehensive refers to being worried or fearful of something that may happen in the future, such as feeling uneasy about an upcoming exam.

The term uneasy refers to a feeling of discomfort, a sense that something isn't quite right or is off. You may feel uneasy about entering a dark and unfamiliar place, for instance.

Worry.wordDefinition:
Apprehensive and worry are both words that describe a feeling of unease or concern about something, but they differ in their connotation and usage.

Worry is a more general term that can describe any kind of concern or anxiety.

Apprehensive describes a more acute or specific feeling of unease, while worry describes a more general or ongoing feeling of concern.

quotes.Text: My parents have let me do whatever I am interested in. Initially, they were apprehensive, but when they realised that filmmaking was my passion and that I was doing a good job with the short films and the recognition in 'Naalaya Iyakkunar' TV show, they supported and encouraged me.
quotes.Title: Indian Director
quotes.Name: Karthik Subbaraj

quotes.Text: A tyrant must put on the appearance of uncommon devotion to religion. Subjects are less apprehensive of illegal treatment from a ruler whom they consider god-fearing and pious. On the other hand, they do less easily move against him, believing that he has the gods on his side.
quotes.Title: Greek Philosopher
quotes.Name: Aristotle

quotes.Text: Whatever any boxer does in the ring, I don't think any reporter should call him a coward. Anyone who does that I lose complete respect for. There's a difference between being a coward and being scared, or apprehensive. Different fighters have got different mentalities.
quotes.Title: British Athlete
quotes.Name: David Haye

quotes.Text: My disorder has been attended with several symptoms of a consumption; and I have been at times apprehensive that my great change was at hand: yet blessed be God, I have never been affrighted; but, on the contrary, at times much delighted with a view of its approach.
quotes.Title: American Clergyman
quotes.Name: David Brainerd

quotes.Text: Everybody was apprehensive about a documentary. When we're all dead and gone, we don't want to leave something that is not going to be representing the band in a true and honest way that shows everything that's important.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Gina Schock

quotes.Text: I hail from a small town. My parents were never apprehensive about my decision to take up acting - they've been a constant support to me.
quotes.Title: Indian Actress
quotes.Name: Sriti Jha

quotes.Text: Persons who have been homeless carry within them a certain philosophy of life which makes them apprehensive about ownership.
quotes.Title: Polish Novelist
quotes.Name: Jerzy Kosinski

quotes.Text: I had become shy of life's bustle in my solitary retreat and was apprehensive at the thought of facing the world.
quotes.Title: Swedish Author
quotes.Name: Selma Lagerlof

quotes.Text: Raaz Reboot' doesn't have extreme boldness, but I was apprehensive about the kissing scenes.
quotes.Title: Indian Model
quotes.Name: Kriti Kharbanda

quotes.Text: You always get apprehensive before you do shoots.
quotes.Title: American Model
quotes.Name: Jenna Morasca
